doc.field: Rapid Transit Subway Construction Company directors waiver
Rapid Transit Subway Construction Company directors waiver
AHMC - Rapid Transit Subway Construction Company
AHMC - Rapid Transit Subway Construction Company

The Rapid Transit Subway Construction Company was formed in 1900 as a vehicle to acquire financing for the construction of New York City's mass transit rail system, and to oversee the construction. This document is a consent form signed by the directors of the company waiving notice of the first meeting of the directors and consenting that the same meeting will be held on February 20, 1900, (which is the date of the signed document) at the office of Messrs. August Belmont & Company, 23 Nassau Street, Manhattan. Signed by all of the 13 directors, among them August Belmont and Cornelius Vanderbilt.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: AHMC - Rapid Transit Subway Construction Company Directors Waiver
